src: Ugbu a, anyị nwere ụmụ oke ọnwa anọ na-arịabu ọrịa shuga mana ha anaghị arịazi ya.
mt: Currently, we have four months of data showing that diabetes is on the rise but not declining.
ref: "We now have 4-month-old mice that are non-diabetic that used to be diabetic," he added.

src: Dr. Ehud Ur, ọkammụta nke ọgwụ na Mahadum Dalhousie nọ na Halifax, Nova Scotia na onye isi oche nke ngalaba ụlọ ọgwụ na sayensi ahụ nke Òtù Ọrịa Shuga ndị Kanada dọrọ aka na ntị na nnyocha ahụ ka nọ n’oge ndị mbụ ya.
mt: Dr. Ehud Ur, a physician at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia and head of the department of medicine at the Canadian HIV Trials Network, said the study is still in its early stages.
ref: Dr. Ehud Ur, professor of medicine at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia and chair of the clinical and scientific division of the Canadian Diabetes Association cautioned that the research is still in its early days.

src: Ka ndị ọkachamara ndị ọzọ, o kwenyeghị na a ga agwọtanwu ọrịa shuga, o depụtara na ihe nchọpụta ndị a enweghị mmetụta nye ndị nwere ọrịa shuga Taịp 1.
mt: As other experts, he does not believe that these tests will cure diabetes, he reports that these tests have no effect on people with Type 1 diabetes.
ref: Like some other experts, he is skeptical about whether diabetes can be cured, noting that these findings have no relevance to people who already have Type 1 diabetes.

src: N'ụbọchị Mọnde, Sara Danius, onye odeakwụkwọ Nobel kọmitii maka akwụkwọ agụmagụ n'ụlọ akwụkwọ Swidin, kwuputara n'ihu ọha na ihe omume redio na Sveriges Redio dị na Swidin, mgbe o siere kọmitii ahụ ike inweta Bob Dilan gbasara mmeri na ihe nrite Nobel na mpaghara Akwụkwọ agụmagụ nke afọ 2016 o nwetara, na ha ahapụlarị mbọ ha na-agba inweta ya.
mt: On Monday, Sara Danius, chairwoman of the Swedish Academy for Literature, announced on a radio show in Sweden that the committee had failed in its attempt to award Bob Dylan the Nobel Prize in Literature for 2016, and that they had given up their efforts to do so.
ref: On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him.

src: Danius si, "Ugbu a anyị anaghị eme ihe ọbụla. Akpọọlam oku ma zijere onye ya na ya kacha arụkọ ozi ịntaneetị ma nwetekwa ụsa nnabata. Ugbua nke ahụ zuru oke."
mt: Danius said, "We do nothing. We call the police and ask them to bring the person who knows the most about the Internet and get an arrest warrant. Today that's done."
ref: Danius said, "Right now we are doing nothing. I have called and sent emails to his closest collaborator and received very friendly replies. For now, that is certainly enough."

src: Na mbu,onye isi Ring, Jamie Siminoff, kwuru na ulo oru ya bidoro mgbe onughi mgbirigba ya n’ulo ahia ya di na ime ebe o na adoba ugboala ya.
mt: Initially, Ring CEO Jamie Siminoff said his idea for the company began when he saw a door-to-door salesman selling his product in a store.
ref: Previously, Ring's CEO, Jamie Siminoff, remarked the company started when his doorbell wasn't audible from his shop in his garage.

src: O kwuru na ọ rụrụ mgbịrịgba ụzọ ji WiFi arụ ọrụ.
mt: He said the road was closed due to a malfunctioning WiFi.
ref: He built a WiFi door bell, he said.

src: Siminoff sị na orire ahịa gbaliri elu ka ogosichara n'ihe nkiri Shak Tank n'afọ 2013 ebe ndị ndozi ihe ngosi jụrụ itinye ego na mbido.
mt: Siminoff said the store closed after appearing on the reality show Shark Tank in 2013, where the show's investors turned down his request for funding.
ref: Siminoff said sales boosted after his 2013 appearance in a Shark Tank episode where the show panel declined funding the startup.

src: Na ngwụcha 2017, e gosiri Siminoff na chanel igbe onyonyo QVC.
mt: 2017, Siminoff appeared on the QVC shopping channel.
ref: In late 2017, Siminoff appeared on shopping television channel QVC.

src: Ring dozikwara otu ikpe ha na ụlọ ọrụ ọzọ na-ahụ maka nchekwa, ADT Corporation nwere.
mt: Ring filed a lawsuit against another security company, ADT Corporation.
ref: Ring also settled a lawsuit with competing security company, the ADT Corporation.

src: Ọ bụ eziokwu na otu ọgwụ mgbochi aka na-ele anya egosila na o nwere ike ịbelata oke ndị mmadụ ji anwụ n'ihi ọrịa Ebola, mana ruo ugbu a, enwebeghi ọgwụ ọbụla gosiri hooha na o nwere ike ịgwọ onye bu ọrịa a.
mt: It is true that one antiviral drug has been shown to reduce the number of people dying from Ebola, but so far no drug has been proven to cure the disease.
ref: While one experimental vaccine appears able to reduce Ebola mortality, up until now, no drugs have been clearly demonstrated suitable for treating existing infection.

src: Otu antibọdi, ZMapp, gosiburu olileanya, mana ka elebakwuru ya anya, achọpụtara na ọbaghị uru na-igbochi ọnwụ ka esiri chee.
mt: An antibody, ZMapp, has raised hopes, but early trials have shown it does not prevent death.
ref: One antibody cocktail, ZMapp, initially showed promise in the field, but formal studies indicated it had less benefit than sought in preventing death.

src: Na nnwale PALM, eji ZMapp mere ihe nruba ama, nke a putara na ndi sayentist jiri ya mee baseline tunyere ogwugwo ato ozo.
mt: In the PALM trial, ZMapp showed a significant survival benefit, which led researchers to use it as a control in the study.
ref: In the PALM trial, ZMapp served as a control, meaning scientists used it as a baseline and compared the three other treatments to it.

src: USA Jimnastiks kwadoro ozi Olimpik Kọmitii Amerịka dere ma kwere kwa na oge eruola mgbe onye ọbụla na-eme Olimpiks aghaghị ịrụkọ ọrụ ọnụ ịhụ na ndị egwuregwu anyị niile nọ na nchekwa.
mt: USA Gymnastics told the U.S. Olympic Committee that it had completed a review of the sexual abuse scandal that rocked the sport and that all athletes will be safe.
ref: USA Gymnastics supports the United States Olympic Committee's letter and accepts the absolute need of the Olympic family to promote a safe environment for all of our athletes.

src: Anyi kwere na ihe USOC dere na odimma ndi egwuregwu anyi na klob ha nakwa egwuregwu ga enweta uru n’ihu karia ma o buru na enwe mgbanwe n’ulo oru anyi kama inapu ndi mmadu asambodo ha.
mt: We believe the USOC's letter to our athletes and the games will provide a fair and equitable opportunity to compete and that there will be no change to our athletes' medals.
ref: We agree with the USOC's statement that the interests of our athletes and clubs, and their sport, may be better served by moving forward with meaningful change within our organization, rather than decertification.

src: Mpaghara jimnasktik nke obodo USA kwadoro nlebara anya nke onwe nke nwere ike igosi ka mmegbu nke ndị lanarịrị ihe mberede Larị Nassar kọwapụtara nwere ike ịbụ ihe metere aka a na-amaghị maka ya na anabatakwa mgbanwe ndị kwesịrị ekwesị.
mt: The USA Gymnastics organization has been criticized for its failure to take action after Nassar's abuse was reported.
ref: USA Gymnastics supports an independent investigation that may shine light on how abuse of the proportion described so courageously by the survivors of Larry Nassar could have gone undetected for so long and embraces any necessary and appropriate changes.

src: Egwuregwu Jimnastik nke mba USA na ndi USOC nwere otu ebumnobi - ime egwuregwu jimnastik, na ndi ozo, enweghi iyi-egwu dika ike kwere nye ogwu egwu isoro nro ha n’uzo n’enweghi iyi-egwu, ziri-ezi na gburu-gburu akwadoro akwado.
mt: The USA Gymnastics and USOC have one goal - to produce gymnasts, and others, who can compete at the highest level without the aid of drugs, steroids and other performance-enhancing substances.
ref: USA Gymnastics and the USOC have the same goal — making the sport of gymnastics, and others, as safe as possible for athletes to follow their dreams in a safe, positive and empowered environment.

src: Na 1960 ga, Brzezinski rụụrụ John F. Kennedy ọrụ dị ka onye ndụmọdụ ya ma mechaa rụọkwa otu ihe ahụ n'oge ọchịchị Lyndon B. Johnson.
mt: 1960, Brzezinski served as an adviser to John F. Kennedy and later served in the same capacity in the administration of Lyndon B. Johnson.
ref: Throughout 1960s, Brzezinski worked for John F. Kennedy as his advisor and then the Lyndon B. Johnson administration.

src: N’ime nghọpụta nke 1976, ọ dụrụ Carter ndụmọdụ gbasara iwu ndị mba ofesi, wee rụzie ọrụ dịka Onye ndụmọdụ Nchekwa Mba (NSA) site na 1977 ruo 1981, na nnọchi Henry Kissinger.
mt: 1976, he advised Carter on foreign policy, and served as National Security Advisor from 1977 to 1981, succeeding Henry Kissinger.
ref: During the 1976 selections he advised Carter on foreign policy, then served as National Security Advisor (NSA) from 1977 to 1981, succeeding Henry Kissinger.

src: Dịka NSA, o nyere Carter aka n’ijikwa ihe omume mbaụwa n’ụzọ kwesiri ekwesi, dị ka Nkwekọrịta Kampụ Devidi, 1978; ihazigharị mmekọrịta US–Chaịna n'afọ ndị dị na ngwụcha agbata afọ 1970 na 1980; Mgbanwe ọchịchị Iran, nke butere nsogbu njigide Iran, 1979; mbuso agha nke Sọviet n’ime Afghanistan, 1979.
mt: As NSA, he advised Carter on how to deal with the Soviet Union, such as the SALT II treaty, 1979; the normalization of US–China relations in the late 1970s and early 1980s; the Iranian Revolution, which led to the Iran hostage crisis, 1979; and the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan, 1979.
ref: As NSA, he assisted Carter in diplomatically handling world affairs, such as the Camp David Accords, 1978; normalizing US–China relations thought the late 1970s; the Iranian Revolution, which led to the Iran hostage crisis, 1979; and the Soviet invasion in Afghanistan, 1979.

src: Aghoputara ihe nkiri ahu Ryan Gosling na Emma Stone no n’ime ya maka nturu ugo di iche iche.
mt: Gosling and Stone were nominated for best acting roles.
ref: The movie, featuring Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone, received nominations in all major categories.

src: E deturu aha Gosling na Stone n'otu ndị nwere ịnweta akara nturu ugo Best Aktọ na Best Aktres, n'otu n'otu.
mt: Gosling and Stone were nominated for Best Actor and Best Actress, respectively.
ref: Gosling and Stone received nominations for Best Actor and Actress respectively.

src: Nhọrọ ndị ọzọ gụnyere Foto Kacha, Onye nhazi, Ọrụ nkiri fiim, Nhazi Kọstuum, Ọrụrụ fiim, Exigbo Egwu fiim Mbu, Nhazi mmeputa, Ọrụrụ Ụda, Mwụghari Ụda na Ezigbo Mmemme mbu.
mt: Other categories include Best Picture, Best Director, Best Actor, Best Actress, Best Cinematography, Best Costume Design, Best Editing, Best Sound and Best Visual Effects.
ref: The other nominations include Best Picture, Director, Cinematography, Costume Design, Film-editing, Original Score, Production Design, Sound Editing, Sound Mixing and Original Screenplay.

src: Abụ abụọ sitere n’ihenkiri ahụ, Ọdishọn (Onye Iberibe Ahu Rọrọ Nrọ) na Obodo Kpakpandu gasị, nwetara aha maka abụ mbụ kacha mma. N’ihe nlere nke Lionsgate natara ntinye aka 26 — karia ihe ndi a.
mt: 2 songs from the soundtrack, "Odishon (Onye Iberibe Ahu Rọrọ Nrọ)" and "Obodo Kpakpandu", won awards for best song. Lionsgate received 26 nominations — a record.
ref: Two songs from the movie, Audition (The Fools Who Dream) and City of Stars, received nominations for best original song. Lionsgate studio received 26 nominations — more than any other studio.

src: Ka ụbọchị Sọnde nọ na ngwụcha, Onye isi ọchịchị obodo Yunaịted Steeti bụ Donald Trọmp, kwuru n'ozi e nyere site n'aka onye ode akwụkwọ ndị nta akụkọ, nke sịrị na ndị agha obodo US ga ahapụ Sirịa.
mt: On Sunday, United States President Donald Trump, said in a statement from his press secretary, that US troops would withdraw from Syria.
ref: Late on Sunday, the United States President Donald Trump, in a statement delivered via the press secretary, announced US troops would be leaving Syria.

src: E kwuputara nke a mgbe Trump na Onyeisiala mba Tọkị bụ Rejep Tayyip Erdoghan nwechara mkparịtaụka n'ekwentị.
mt: This was announced after Trump and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan had a phone call.
ref: The announcement was made after Trump had a phone conversation with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.

src: Mba Turkey ga-anarakwa ichebe ndị agha ISIS enwudere ndị, ozi ahụ kwuru, na mba ndị dị na Europe ajụla ịnabata ha ọzọ.
mt: Turkey will host a conference to discuss the repatriation of ISIS fighters, the statement said, as European countries refuse to take them back.
ref: Turkey would also take over guarding captured ISIS fighters which, the statement said, European nations have refused to repatriate.

src: Nke a na-egosi na, opekata mpe, ụfọdụ daịnosọọ nwere abụba; ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ nwere echiche a taa, mana ihe ọzọ bụ na ọ na-egosi anyị ihe fosịl enweghị ike igosi, dịka agba na nhazi akụkụ-atọ.
mt: This shows that, at least in theory, some dinosaurs had feathers; many people still believe this, but it also shows that we can't tell, like a bird and a plane.
ref: This not only confirms that at least some dinosaurs had feathers, a theory already widespread, but provides details fossils generally cannot, such as color and three-dimensional arrangement.

src: Ndị ọka mmụta sayensị kwuru na abụba anụmanụ a nwere mgbe ọ na-acha aja aja n'elu ma na-acha ka karotenọịd n'okpuru.
mt: Scientists say the animal has a green back and orange carotenoid underbelly.
ref: . Scientists say this animal's plumage was chestnut-brown on top with a pale or carotenoid-colored underside.

src: Ihe nchọpụta ahụ nyekwara ntụziaka gbasara mmalite ipu nku n'ụmụ nnụnụ.
mt: The study also gave advice on the origin of bird flu.
ref: The find also grants insight into the evolution of feathers in birds.

src: Maka na nku ajọ anụ daịnosọ enweghị akụ toro nke ọma, nke a na akpọ rachis, ma na o nwere ihe ndị ọzọ nke na-enwe - dịka barbs na barbules - ndị nchọpụta ihe kwuru na ọdịka rachis ọbụ ihe mechara si n'ihe ndị ọzọ a were toputa.
mt: Because the bird's feathers lack the usual good insulation, the rachis, and other structures such as barbs and barbules, the researchers said the rachis was the first to be shed.
ref: Because the dinosaur feathers do not have a well-developed shaft, called a rachis, but do have other features of feathers — barbs and barbules — the researchers inferred the rachis was likely a later evolutionary development that these other features.

src: Nhazi nku ha gosiri na ha ejighi ya efe efe kama ha ji ya edokwa okpomọkụ maọbụ eme ihe ngosi. Ndị nchọpụta ihe tụrụ aro sị na, n'agbanyeghị na nke a bụ ọdụ daịnosọ na-eto eto, ihe ngosi ahụ gosiri nku anụ tochara etocha na-abụghị nku nwa anụ.
mt: The design of the device suggests that it can be used to cool or heat food or to make a presentation. Researchers suggest, however, that despite being a new type of incubator, the device does not appear to be a new type of incubator.
ref: The feathers' structure suggests that they were not used in flight but rather for temperature regulation or display. The researchers suggested that, even though this is the tail of a young dinosaur, the sample shows adult plumage and not a chick's down.

src: Ndị nchọpụta ihe tụrụ aro sị na, n'agbanyeghị na nke a bụ ọdụ daịnosọ na-eto eto, ihe ngosi ahụ gosiri nku anụ tochara etocha na-abụghị nku nwa anụ.
mt: Researchers say, despite being a new product, the device showed a 99.9% accuracy in distinguishing between human and animal DNA.
ref: The researchers suggested that, even though this is the tail of a young dinosaur, the sample shows adult plumage and not a chick's down.

src: Otu bọmbụ gbawara n'isi ụlọ ọrụ ndị uwe ojii n’ime Gaziantep, Tọkii ụtụtụ ụnyaahụ na-egbu ndị uwe ojii abụọ ma merụọ ahụ ihe karịrị ndị mmadụ ọzọ iri abụọ.
mt: A bomb exploded at a police station in Gaziantep, killing two police officers and injuring more than 20 people.
ref: A car bomb detonated at police headquarters in Gaziantep, Turkey yesterday morning killed two police officers and injured more than twenty other people.

src: Ụlọ ọrụ gọvanọ kwuru iri na itoolu na ndị merụrụ ahụ bụ ndị uwe ojii.
mt: 19 people were injured, all police officers.
ref: The governor's office said nineteen of the injured were police officers.

src: Ndị uwe ojii sị na ha na-enyo otu onye a na-ebo ebubo na ọ bụ onye agha nnupuisi Daesh (ISIL) dịka onye mere mwakpo ahụ.
mt: Police say they believe the suspect is a member of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) who carried out the attack.
ref: Police said they suspect an alleged Daesh (ISIL) militant of responsibility for the attack.

src: Ha chọpụtara na Anyanwụ na-arụ ọrụ n’otu ụdị isi iwu dịka kpakpandu ndị ọzọ: A chọpụtara na omume kpakpandu niile nọ na sistemụ bụ onwunwu ọkụ na ntụgharị ha na-anya ha, ma ọ nweghị ihe ọzọ..
mt: They have found that the East is working in one type of legal system as the others: They have found that all the actions of the system are solid fuel and their movement is driven by them, and there is nothing else..
ref: They found the Sun operated on the same basic principles as other stars: The activity of all stars in the system was found to be driven by their luminosity, their rotation, and nothing else.

src: A na-ejikọta ọnụ ọnwụnwụ ọkụ na ntụgharị ya amata akara Rossby nke otu kpakpando, nke metụtara na ọwụwụ plasma.
mt: The deaths and roll-over are attributed to the Rossby wave of one cyclone, which is associated with plasma plume.
ref: The luminosity and rotation are used together to determine a star's Rossby number, which is related to plasma flow.

src: Ka akara Rossby na-adị obere karịa, ka arụmarụ na-adịkwu obere nke kpakpando n’ikwanye ugwu nye ụmụ ntụgharị nke ihendọta.
mt: As the Rossby radius decreases, the eddy becomes smaller and more likely to be carried up by the wind.
ref: The smaller the Rossby number, the less active the star with respect to magnetic reversals.

src: Na njem ya, Iwasaki banyere na nsogbu ọtụtụ mgbe.
mt: On his flight, Iwasaki encountered several problems.
ref: During his trip, Iwasaki ran into trouble on many occasions.

src: Ndị ohi ụgbọ mmiri zuri ya ohi, nkịta ara lụsoro ya ọgụ, o siri na-alụm di na nwunye gbalaga na Nepal a tụọ ya nga na India.
mt: The ship was sunk by pirates, the crew was rescued, the captain's wife and daughter were killed in Nepal and his son was killed in India.
ref: He was robbed by pirates, attacked in Tibet by a rabid dog, escaped marriage in Nepal and was arrested in India.

src: Oke 802.11n na arụ ọrụ ma na frikwensi nke 2.4Ghz na nke 5.0Ghz.
mt: 802.11n devices work at both 2.4GHz and 5.0GHz frequencies.
ref: The 802.11n standard operates on both the 2.4Ghz and 5.0Ghz frequencies.

src: Nke a ga-enye ya ohere ka dịrị na ndakọta nlaghachi azụ na 802.11a, 802.11b na 802.11g, ma ọ bụrụhaala na isi ebe ahụ ụgbọigwe na-anọ nwere redìò abụọ.
mt: This will allow it to be used in the 802.11a, 802.11b and 802.11g standards, provided the device it is connected to has two radios.
ref: This will allow it to be backwards compatible with 802.11a, 802.11b and 802.11g, provided that the base station has dual radios.

src: Na 802.11n, ọsịsọ ya ji nnukwu ihe kara nke ndị bu ya ụzọ; ya mere, ọrụ ọ na-arụpụta ga-eru 600Mbit/s.
mt: 802.11n uses a larger number of channels than its predecessors; thus, its work can reach 600Mbit/s.
ref: The speeds of 802.11n are substantially faster than that of its predecessors with a maximum theoretical throughput of 600Mbit/s.

src: Duval, bụ onye lụgoro nwanyị ma mụta ụmụ abụọ bụgoro okenye, a hapụghịrị Mila onyere akọọrọ akụkọ nnukwu ihe nlere anya.
mt: Duval, who was married and had two children with his first wife, was left with Mila, who was pregnant with their first child.
ref: Duvall, who is married with two adult children, did not leave a big impression on Miller, to whom the story was related.

src: Mgbe a sị ya kwuo okwu gbasara ihe mere, Mila kwuru, "Mike na-ekwu ọtụtụ okwu mgbe a na-eme ọnụnụ ahụ...anọ m na-akwado ya mere na anụghị m ihe ọ na-ekwu."
mt: When asked about what he said, Mila replied, "Mike says a lot of things when he's in that state...I support him because I don't know what he's saying."
ref: When asked for comment, Miller said, "Mike talks a lot during the hearing...I was getting ready so I wasn't really hearing what he was saying."

src: Anyị ga-agba mbọ belata ikuku kabon dioxide kwa nke Mkpokọta ihe nrụpụta obodo site na oke 2020 site n'ọkwa 2005, Hu kwuru.
mt: We will strive to reduce carbon dioxide emissions per capita of urban construction from the current level of 2020 to 2005, Hu said.
ref: "We will endeavour to cut carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP by a notable margin by 2020 from the 2005 level," Hu said.

src: O kwughi oke a ga-akwụ, kama ọ sị na a ga-ele anya na nrụpụta akụ na ụba China wee kwụọ ụgwọ.
mt: He said the country would not be able to afford the cost of building its economy if it were to pay reparations.
ref: He did not set a figure for the cuts, saying they will be made based on China's economic output.

src: Hu gbara obodo ndị na emepe emepe ume "ka ha ghara itinye aka n'usoro omume mgbe ochie bụ ibu ụzọ metọọ were kpochawa ma emechaa."
mt: "The city's historic preservationists are urging residents not to alter the original design of the building by adding on to it."
ref: Hu encouraged developing countries "to avoid the old path of polluting first and cleaning up later."

src: O tinyekwara na "ha ekwela ka adị ha buru ibu karịrị ogugo uto na ike ha."
mt: It also noted that "the aircraft was flying at a height of more than 10,000 feet and at a speed of more than 500 miles per hour."
ref: He added that "they should not, however, be asked to take on obligations that go beyond their development stage, responsibility and capabilities."

src: Òtù Mmụta Irak ahụ gosipụtara nchọpụta ya na 12.00 GMT taa.
mt: 12.00 GMT today, an Iraqi university has announced its findings.
ref: The Iraq Study Group presented its report at 12.00 GMT today.

src: Ọ dọrọ aka na ntị sị na onweghị onye ga-ekwe nkwa na usoro ọbụla e jiri mee ihe na mba Aịrak ugbu a ga-akwụsị agha otu, ntolite ihe ike, maọbụ ndabanye n'ọgbaghara.
mt: He said that no one can guarantee that the current process in Iraq will end the war, bring stability, or lead to elections.
ref: It warns No one can guarantee that any course of action in Iraq at this point will stop sectarian warfare, growing violence, or a slide toward chaos.

src: Di Rịpọt bidoro site n'ịkpọ oku ka onye ọbụla nwee mkpakọrịta ụka ma nwee nkwekọrịta n'Amerịka gbasara etu aga na-esi akpaso ndị Etiti Ọwụwa Anyanwụ agwa.
mt: The Pope called for dialogue and agreement in America regarding the treatment of the indigenous peoples of the Americas.
ref: The Report opens with plea for open debate and the formation of a consensus in the United States about the policy towards the Middle East.

src: Ọ fọrọ obere ka mkpesa ahụ kwuo okwu ofụma gbasara akụkụ nile nke iwu ndị isi n'ebe mba Aịrak nọ ma ọ na-akwado mgbanwe ụzọ ozigbo ozigbo.
mt: He also criticized the entire legal system of the country of Iraq and supported gradual change.
ref: The Report is highly critical of almost every aspect of the present policy of the Executive towards Iraq and it urges an immediate change of direction.

src: Nke izizi n'ime nkwado iri asaa na asatọ ya bụ na a ga-eso usoro ọchịchị ọhụrụ tupu ọgwụgwụ afọ ị hụ na echebere oke ala Aịrak megide ndị ọchọ okwu ma wughachikwa mmekọrịta ọchịchị ha na agbataobi ha.
mt: 1 of the 7 points is to ensure a new political process before the end of the year to ensure the security of the territory of Iraq against the terrorists and to restore its political relations with its neighbors.
ref: First among its 78 recommendations is that a new diplomatic initiative should be taken before the end of this year to secure Iraq’s borders against hostile interventions and to re-establish diplomatic relations with its neighbors.

src: Onye omeiwu nakwa nwunye onyeisiala mba Argentina bụ Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner mara ọkwa na mgbede ụnyahụ na La Plata, obodo nọpụrụ kilomita 50 (maịlụ 31)site na Buenos Aires na ọ ga-eso zọọ ọkwa onyeisiala mba Argentina.
mt: A senator and the wife of the Argentine president, Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner, was injured in a shooting in La Plata, a city 50 kilometers (31 miles) from Buenos Aires, and is expected to run for president of Argentina.
ref: Current senator and Argentine First Lady Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner announced her presidential candidacy yesterday evening in La Plata, a city 50 kilometers (31 miles) away from Buenos Aires.

src: Ọ bụ n'Ajentaịn Tiyeta ka Lọọlọ Kirchner kwuputara ebumnuche ya ịzọ maka ọkwa onye isi ala, otu ebe ahụ ọ ji bido kampen ya maka ọkwa Sịnetọ na 2005 dịka onye otu nke ndị mpaghara Buenos Aires zigara.
mt: It was in Tucumán that Néstor Kirchner announced his intention to run for the presidency, one of the provinces where he campaigned for a Senate seat in 2005 as a member of the Buenos Aires district delegation.
ref: Mrs. Kirchner announced her intention to run for president at the Argentine Theatre, the same location she used to start her 2005 campaign for the Senate as member of the Buenos Aires province delegation.

src: Ọ bụ esemokwu maka mmefu ego na nkwado na nrụgharị e mere mgbe Oke ikuku Katrina gasịrị kpatara arụmụka a; ụfọdụ ndị kweere na iji nwayọ emefụ ego steeti akọwaala mmefụ a n'ụzọ ntọrọmọchị dịka "Nkwekọrịta Niu Ọlịns nke Bush mere".
mt: Disputes over funding and support for the rebuilding effort following Hurricane Katrina caused the controversy; some critics argued that the federal government's allocation of funds to the rebuilding effort was "a Bush administration deal".
ref: The debate was sparked by controversy over spending on relief and reconstruction in the wake Hurricane Katrina; which some fiscal conservatives have humorously labeled "Bush's New Orleans Deal."

src: Nnyocha nke mgbalị nrụgharị chere ihu na-enye ndị e chere na ha bụ ndị si Wọshịntịn ọrụ nrụgharị.
mt: A study of the effort found that it gave people who thought they were from Washington jobs.
ref: Liberal criticism of the reconstruction effort has focused on the awarding of reconstruction contracts to perceived Washington insiders.

src: Ihe karịrị nde mmadụ anọ gara Rom maka olili ahụ.
mt: 4 million people attended the event.
ref: Over four million people went to Rome to attend the funeral.

src: Ọnụ ọgụgụ ndị mmadụ nọ ebe n'ahụ dị ukwuu nke na o kweghị mmadụ niile omume inwèta òhèrè n'olili ozu na St. Peter Square.
mt: The number of people present at the event was so great that not all of them could fit into the St. Peter Square.
ref: The number of people present was so large that it was not possible for everybody to gain access to the funeral in St. Peter's Square.

src: Etinyere ọtụtụ nnukwu igwe onyonyo n'ọtụtụ ebe na Rom, ka ndị mmadụ nwee ike kirie mmemme ahụ.
mt: Large screens were placed in several locations in Rome, so people could watch the event.
ref: Several large television screens were installed in various places in Rome to let the people watch the ceremony.

src: N'ọtụtụ obodo Itali ndị ọzọ ma na uwa nile, ọkachasị na Poland, emere nkwazi dị ka ibe ya, nke ọtụtụ mmadụ hụrụ.
mt: In other Italian cities and across the country, especially in Poland, similar protests were held, with many people watching.
ref: In many other cities of Italy and in the rest of the world, particularly in Poland, similar setups were made, which were viewed by a great number of people.

src: Ndị akụkọala akọtọla ụmụ iwuikikere FBI ndị gara aga maka ịgbado anya akụrụngwa n’ụmụ okwu ndị dị mfe ikpezi, tụmadị ụmụ okwu ụgbọ ala ezuru ezuru, n’iji ebumnobi nke ịkwalite nsìàga ọganihu ha.
mt: Former FBI agents who testified last year about their use of controversial interrogation techniques, including waterboarding, to extract information from suspected terrorists, said they did so in the interest of national security.
ref: Historians have criticized past FBI policies for focusing resources on cases which are easy to solve, especially stolen car cases, with the intent of boosting the agency's success rate.

src: Nzukọ omeiwu bidoro ikwado nnyocha ihe ndị dị aṅaa na fiskal n'afọ 2005 ma kwukwaa kpọmkwem na ngalaba FBI ga ewepụtarịrị ndị ozi iri maka ihe ngosi na-akpali agụụ mmekọrịta nwoke na nwanyị.
mt: 2005 budget hearings began approving funding for existing programs and specifically stated that the FBI would be removed from the list of agencies to receive funds for programs promoting sexual attraction between men and women.
ref: Congress began funding the obscenity initiative in fiscal 2005 and specified that the FBI must devote 10 agents to adult pornography.

src: Robin Uthappa nwetara akara kachasị na innings, ọsọ 70 n’ime naanị ụmụ bọọlụ 41 site n’ịkụ anọ ugboro 11 na isii ugboro 2.
mt: Robin Uthappa scored the highest score in an innings, 70 runs in just 41 balls with four fours and six sixes.
ref: Robin Uthappa made the innings highest score, 70 runs in just 41 balls by hitting 11 fours and 2 sixes.

src: Ndị na-eji batị akụ n'usoro etiti, Sachin Tendulkar na Rahul Dravid rụrụ ọrụ nke ọma ma mee otu nrụkọọrụ nke ọsọ-otu narị.
mt: Middle-order batsmen Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul Dravid did well and put on a century partnership.
ref: Middle order batsmen, Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul Dravid, performed well and made a hundred-run partnership.

src: Mana, mgbe ha dara wicket India naanị mere 36 gbara ọ tọpụ wicket 7 iji kwụsị innings.
mt: However, when India lost their wicket only 36 runs were scored off 7 overs to end the innings.
ref: But, after losing the captain's wicket India only made 36 runs loosing 7 wickets to end the innings.

src: U.S. Onye isi oche Jiọj W. Bush batata Singapọ n'ụtụtụ ụbọchị nke iri na isii nke ọnwa Nọvemba, iji malite njem njegharị mba Eshia nke ga-anọzu otu izuụka.
mt: U.S. President George W. Bush will arrive in Singapore on November 16 for a one-day Asian tour.
ref: U.S. President George W. Bush arrived in Singapore the morning of November 16, beginning a week-long tour of Asia.

src: Onye na-esote onye isi iche mba Sịngapọ bụ Wong Kan Seng nabatara ya ma ya na onye isi oche mba Sịngapọ bụ Lee Hsien Loong kparịtara ụka gbasara ahịa na ihe iyi ọha egwu.
mt: 2nd Deputy Prime Minister Wong Kan Seng received it and Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong later signed the bill into law.
ref: He was greeted by Singapore's Deputy Prime Minister Wong Kan Seng and discussed trade and terrorism issues with the Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong.

src: Mgbe otu izu gasịrị ebe ọ dara ada na ntuliaka ọkara oge, Bush gwara ndị na-ege ya ntị maka mmụba nke azụmahịa n'Eshia.
mt: After one day of voting, Bush told reporters that he was encouraged by the increase in Asian business.
ref: After a week of losses in the midterm election, Bush told an audience about the expansion of trade in Asia.

src: Onye isi oche Stivin Hapa ekwetala iziga iwu ọhụrụ nke ikuku ọcha nke gọọmenti ebe a ga elebara ya anya, tupu nleba anya nke abụọ, ma emechaa nzukọ ga-ewe ya na onye isi NDP bụ Jak Leeton nkeji iri abụọ na ise n'ụbọchị Tuzde na PMO.
mt: Prime Minister Stivin Hapa agreed to bring forward the new air quality law that the government will highlight, before the second reading, and will conclude the meeting with NDP leader Jak Leeton at 8:30 pm on Tuesday at PMO.
ref: Prime Minister Stephen Harper has agreed to send the government's 'Clean Air Act' to an all-party committee for review, before its second reading, after Tuesday's 25 minute meeting with NDP leader Jack Layton at the PMO.

src: Layton arịọla maka mgbanwe nye akwụkwọ iwu gburugburu ebe obibi nke ndị otu ọdịkaọgadị mgbe ya na PM nwere nnọkọ, na-arịọ maka "ndezigharị zuru oke nke zuru ezu" nke iwu gburugburu ebe obibi nke ndị otu ọdịkaọgadị
mt: Layton called for changes to the environmental protection act of the conservation council after meeting with PM, calling for "comprehensive" changes to the environmental protection act of the conservation council
ref: Layton had asked for changes to the conservatives' environmental bill during the meeting with the PM, asking for a "thorough and complete rewriting" of the Conservative party's environmental bill.

src: Kemgbe gọọmenti weere ọnọdụ ịkwụ ụgwọ ụlọ ọgwụ Mersey na Devọnpọt, Tasmania, gọọmenti steeti na ụfọdụ ndị ome iwu gọọmenti etiti ekwuola okwu megide omume a sị na ọ bụ mere mere n'ihu maka ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị gọọmenti etiti na-abịa na Nọvemba.
mt: Since the government took over the Mersey and Devonport hospitals in Tasmania, the state government and some members of the federal government have spoken out against this move, saying it was done for political reasons and came before the federal government's November budget.
ref: Ever since the Federal Government stepped in to take over funding of the Mersey hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, the state government and some federal MPs have criticised this act as a stunt in the prelude to the federal election to be called by November.

src: Mana Prime Minista John Howard ekwuola na ihe a mere bụ naanị ka ichebe ụmụ akụrụngwa nke ụlọ ọgwụ ahụ site n'aka mwedàta siri n'aka gọọmentị Tasmania, n'inye mmezi nke nde AUD$45.
mt: Prime Minister John Howard said the incident was only to protect the hospital's equipment from the Tasmanian government's floods, giving a discount of AUD$45 million.
ref: But Prime Minister John Howard has said the act was only to safeguard the facilities of the hospital from being downgraded by the Tasmanian government, in giving an extra AUD$45 million.

src: Dika obere akwụkwọ akụkọ kachasị ohuru si kwuo, ogugu oke osimiri gosiri na oke ikuku malitere. O doro anya na enwere oru oke ikuku na mpaghara Pago Pago na Niue.
mt: As a small news article put it, the water level rose and the wind speed increased. It was clear that there was a lot of wind in the Pago Pago and Niue area.
ref: According to the latest bulletin, sea level readings indicated a tsunami was generated. There was some definite tsunami activity recorded near Pago Pago and Niue.

src: O nweghị nnukwu mmebi ma ọ bụ mmerụ ahụ akọrọna n’ime Tonga, mana e were ọkụ nwa oge, nke a kọrọ gbochiri ndị ọchịchị Tongan ịnata ịdọ aka na ntị maka ajọ ebili mmiri PTWC ahụ nyere.
mt: There were no major damage or injuries reported in Tonga, but the fire did delay the government from receiving a tsunami warning from PTWC.
ref: No major damage or injuries have been reported in Tonga, but power was temporarily lost, which reportedly prevented Tongan authorities from receiving the tsunami warning issued by the PTWC.

src: Ụlọ akwụkwọ iri na anọ na Hawaii ndị nọ na ma ọ bụ na nso akụkụ mmiri bụ ndị e mechiri na Wenezdee niile na-agbanyeghị ndọ aka na ntị niile ewepụrụ.
mt: 18 schools in Hawaii and near the water are closed due to the tsunami all day.
ref: Fourteen schools in Hawaii located on or near coastlines were closed all of Wednesday despite the warnings being lifted.

src: Onyeisiala mba Amerịka bụ George W. Bush nabatara ọkwa ahụ.
mt: U.S. President George W. Bush accepted the nomination.
ref: U.S. President George W. Bush welcomed the announcement.

src: Gọdọn Jọndro onye na-ekwuchitere Bush okwu kpọrọ nkwa Nọt Koria bụ "nzọụkwụ dị oke mkpa na ịnweta mwepụ were anya nke ngwa agha nuklia ndị Koria."
mt: 2004 Republican presidential candidate George W. Bush's representative to North Korea said "a very important step" was taken in achieving the removal of North Korea's nuclear weapons.
ref: Bush spokesman Gordon Johndroe called North Korea's pledge "a major step towards the goal of achieving the verifiable denuclearization of the Korean peninsula."

src: Oke ifufe nke iri abụrụ aha nke oge oke ifufe Atlantik, Oke ifufe akpọrọ Jeri, gbakọrọ n'oke osimiri atlantik taa.
mt: 10-year Atlantic hurricane season record holder, Hurricane Jerry, is currently over the Atlantic Ocean.
ref: The tenth named storm of the Atlantic Hurricane season, Subtropical Storm Jerry, formed in the Atlantic Ocean today.

src: Ụlọọrụ Etiti na-ahụ maka Ajọ ifufe (NHC) kwuru sị n’oge a Jeri abụghị ihe iyi egwu nye ala.
mt: The National Hurricane Center (NHC) said at this time Jerry is not a threat to land.
ref: The National Hurricane Center (NHC) says that at this point Jerry poses no threat to land.

src: Ụlọ Ọrụ nke Ndị injinia nke U.S. mere atụmatụ na mmiri mmiri dị inchi isii nwere ike ịgabiga ihe mgbochi ide mmiri e mebibiri na mbụ.
mt: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers estimated that six inches of rain could overwhelm the flood control structures that were first built.
ref: The U.S. Corps of Engineers estimated that 6 inches of rainfall could breach the previously damaged levees.

src: Ward Itoolu, nke hụrụ oke ide mmiri ruru ihe dị ka feet iri abụọ n'oge Ajọ Ifufe Katrina, nọ na nnukwu mmiri na eru ukwu ma gafere akwa levee nọ nso.
mt: Ward Island, which saw floodwaters rise to about 20 feet during Hurricane Katrina, is now under water and overtopped levees nearby.
ref: The Ninth Ward, which saw flooding as high as 20 feet during Hurricane Katrina, is currently in waist-high water as the nearby levee was overtopped.

src: Mmiri n’aghafu n’otu akuku levee obodobo ya di 100feet.
mt: 100 feet of levee was breached by water.
ref: Water is spilling over the levee in a section 100 feet wide.

src: Onye nchikwa commons Adam Cuerden gosiputara iwe ya  n’elu ihe eghichapuru mgbe ogwara Wikinews okwu n’onwa gara gara.
mt: Commons guard Adam Cuerden posted a picture of himself on top of the globe when Wikinews reported on the annual event.
ref: Commons Administrator Adam Cuerden expressed his frustration over the deletions when he spoke to Wikinews last month.

src: O (Wales) n’ezie turu anyi asi site na mbido. Mbu, site na ikpa-agwa ka ihe a bu okwu iwu, Nke abuo, site na igho-aghugho na ona ege anyi nti, ruori mgbe ehichapuru nka ya.
mt: (Wales) We have been here since the beginning. But, by the way, the word "law" is used, two, by the way, and it has been given to us, until it is finished.
ref: "He [Wales] basically lied to us from the start. First, by acting as if this was for legal reasons. Second, by pretending he was listening to us, right up to his art deletion."

src: Mkpadu iwe obodo butere maka mgbali ide iwu gbasara ihe ngosi mmekọahụ na webụsaịtị na-egosi ọtụtụ ihe.
mt: A local ordinance was passed to regulate adult entertainment on websites showing a variety of content.
ref: The community irritation led to current efforts to draft a policy regarding sexual content for the site which hosts millions of openly-licensed media.

src: Ọrụ arụrụ bụkarịrị nke iwu a ka na enyocha enyocha, mana edere usoro omume ihe ahụ ka o gosipụta ihe ahụtara ụyọkọ kpakpando Sajiterius.
mt: The work is usually done by law enforcement, but the procedure is designed to show the suspect a lineup of Sajiterius.
ref: The work done was mostly theoretical, but the program was written to simulate observations made of the Sagittarius galaxy.

src: Mmetụta otu ahụ nọ na-achọ ga-esite n'aka ikikere taịdị ndị dị n'etiti mata ojii nke galaxy na mata ojii nke Milky Way.
mt: The effect is seen in the region between the galactic plane and the galactic center.
ref: The effect the team was looking for would be caused by tidal forces between the galaxy's dark matter and the Milky Way's dark matter.

src: Dị ka ọnwa na etinye ndọta n’ụwa, na-akpata elili mmiri, etu ahụ ka Milky Way ahụ si etinye ike na galazi Sagittarius ahụ.
mt: As the year draws to a close, the Milky Way is about to enter its most active phase in the constellation Sagittarius.
ref: Just like the moon exerts a pull on the earth, causing tides, so does the Milky Way exert a force on the Sagittarius galaxy.

src: Ndị ọka mmụta sayensị nwere ike kwubie na dak mata na emetụta dak mata ibe ya otu mata si eme.
mt: Scientists may be able to prove that matter affects other matter the same way it affects itself.
ref: The scientists were able to conclude that the dark matter affect other dark matter in the same way regular matter does.

src: Tiori a na-ekwu na imirikiti mata dị oji gburugburu otu ụyọkọ kpakpando dị na gburugburu otu ụyọkọ kpakpando n'otu ụdị halo, ma e mejupụtara ya site n'ọtụtụ urughuru dị obere.
mt: The report says the halo was caused by a group of ice crystals in a similar shape, all of the same type, and made up of many small pieces.
ref: This theory says that most dark matter around a galaxy is located around a galaxy in a kind of halo, and is made of lots of small particles.

src: Ụmụ akụkọ si telivishọn na-egosi anwụrụ ọcha si n'igwe nrụpụta ahụ apụta.
mt: News crews filming the crash site emerge.
ref: Television reports show white smoke coming from the plant.

src: Ndị isi obodo na-adọ ndị bi n'obodo gburugburu igwe ọrụ ahụ aka na ntị ka ha nọrọ n'ime ụlọ, gbanyụọ ntụ oyi ma ghara iṅu mmiri na-agba n'ụlọ.
mt: Local officials urged residents around the plant to stay indoors, turn off air conditioning and refrain from using water that might be contaminated.
ref: Local authorities are warning residents in the vicinity of the plant to stay indoors, turn off air-conditioners and not to drink tap water.

src: Na ndabere nke ụlọ ọrụ nuklia Japan, a chọpụtawo n'ụlọ mmepụta cesium na ayodiin dị redioaktivu.
mt: The Japan Atomic Energy Agency has found cesium and iodine-131 radioactivity in the water.
ref: According to Japan's nuclear agency, radioactive caesium and iodine has been identified at the plant.

src: Ndị isi chere na nke a na-egosi na o nwere ike gbọmgbọm ndị ji mmanụ ụgbọ yurenium agbawaala ma na-ehi ehi.
mt: They believe this shows that uranium-enriched fuel rods can be safely stored.
ref: Authorities speculate that this indicates that containers holding uranium fuel at the site may have ruptured and are leaking.

src: Dr. Toni Moll chọpụtara nje Tubakụlọsis (XDR-TB) nke na-emegide ọgwụ na ngalaba Sawụt Afrịka nke KwaZulu-Natal.
mt: Dr. Toni Moll identified a strain of Tuberculosis (XDR-TB) resistant to drugs in the Africa Health Department of KwaZulu-Natal.
ref: Dr. Tony Moll discovered the Extremely Drug Resistant Tuberculosis (XDR-TB) in the South African region KwaZulu-Natal.

src: N'otu ajụjụ ọnụ, ọ sị na bke ọhụrụ a na enye "oke nsogbu ma bụrụkwa ihe egwu n'ihi ogugo ọnwụ dị elu si na ya abịa."
mt: In an interview, he said the new aircraft would be "a problem and a threat because of its high altitude."
ref: In an interview, he said the new variant was "very highly troubling and alarming because of the very high fatality rate."

src: Ụfọdụ ndị ọrịa enweela ike ibute ọrịa ahụ n'ụlọ ọgwụ, Dr. Moll cheere, ma ihe dị ka abụọ bụ ndị ọrụ ụlọ ọgwụ.
mt: Some patients have contracted the disease in hospitals, Dr. Moll said, including two hospital workers.
ref: Some patients might have contracted the bug in the hospital, Dr. Moll thinks, and at least two were hospital health workers.
